meanings.definition: Make (a liquid) thinner or weaker by adding water or another solvent to it.
meanings.sent1: She was diluting the juice with water to make it less sweet.
meanings.sent2: The chef was diluting the sauce to adjust the flavor.
meanings.sent3: By diluting the paint, the artist accidentally created a pastel masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The idea of diluting the truth with lies only leads to confusion.
meanings.sent5: The rain was diluting the colors of the sidewalk chalk drawings, creating a watercolor effect.

meanings.definition: To make (something) weaker in force, content, or value by modifying it.
meanings.sent1: The student was diluting the essay by adding unnecessary details.
meanings.sent2: The company risked diluting its brand by expanding too quickly.
meanings.sent3: Diluting the strength of the team with inexperienced players proved to be a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter diluted the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers diluted the smell of paint in the room, creating a pleasant atmosphere.
